pageContext.claim: “How about these fraudulent writers at The New York Times? They get Pulitzer Prize and they got it all wrong. They have to give back their Pulitzer Prize. But that's a fix also, isn't it? ‘I've just won the Pulitzer Prize for talking about Trump and Russia.’ But they were all wrong now.”
pageContext.analysis: The Mueller report relies on and cites reporting from the Times and other Pulitzer-winning news organizations. Special counsel Robert S. Mueller III found that the Trump campaign was aware of and welcomed Russian help in the 2016 election, but there was not enough evidence for conspiracy charges. Mueller also found multiple instances of potential obstruction of justice by Trump, who tried to derail the investigation.
